title: Please, no politicians on I'm a Celebrity next year, say Ant and Dec
description: Ant and Dec have urged ITV executives for a year “without politicians” on I’m A Celebrity...Get Me Out of Here following the appearances of Matt Hancock and Nigel Farage.

title: Disabled five-year-old ‘excited’ to spend first proper Christmas with buddy dog
description: The mother of a severely disabled child whose face “lit up with joy” when he got a buddy dog says the youngster is “excited” to spend his first proper Christmas with the pet. Nicole Dodd-Moore’s five-year-old son JJ is severely disabled, immobile and non-verbal.

title: Hotel syndicate planning special Christmas party after £1m EuroMillions win
description: Syndicate leader Darren Gargan is planning a holiday to Lapland and other foreign trips after 13 staff members scooped £76,923 each.

title: UK Manufacturing PMI: Industry downturn eases in November
description: The UK manufacturing industry downturn eased in November, with industry potentially turning a corner as the end of the year approaches, according to the latest S&P Global / CIPS UK Manufacturing PMI®.

title: Starmer can kick BBC licence fee political football into touch
description: Wise heads believe it’s time to kick the licence fee political football into touch. Expect an incoming Labour government to consider creating an independent panel to set the level, removing the big stick Downing Street wields over the corporation.
